  • Constructor Details

    • AlterManager

      public AlterManager()
      Instantiates a new alter manager. Loads the save file to populate the alterList.

  • Method Details

    • onBlockPlaced

      public void onBlockPlaced​(org.bukkit.event.block.BlockPlaceEvent event)
      On block placed. This is the general catch-all for detecting the creation of altars
      Parameters:
      event - the event

    • onBlockBreak

      public void onBlockBreak​(org.bukkit.event.block.BlockBreakEvent event)
      On block break. This is the general catch-all for detecting the destruction of altars. Should check to see who broke it. Was it sabotage? Or is a believer rebelling.
      Parameters:
      event - the event

    • onBlockBurn

      public void onBlockBurn​(org.bukkit.event.block.BlockBurnEvent event)
      On block burn. Can natural, can be caused by players. The block is destroyed when it is burned, so the alter is broken.
      Parameters:
      event - the event

    • onBlockDamage

      public void onBlockDamage​(org.bukkit.event.block.BlockDamageEvent event)
      On block damage. This is called as the block is being broken
      Parameters:
      event - the event

    • onBlockExplode

      public void onBlockExplode​(org.bukkit.event.block.BlockExplodeEvent event)
      On block explode. Could be natural, could be cause by a player.
      Parameters:
      event - the event

    • onBlockFade

      public void onBlockFade​(org.bukkit.event.block.BlockFadeEvent event)
      On block fade. Unlikley this will ever occur
      Parameters:
      event - the event

    • onBlockFertilize

      public void onBlockFertilize​(org.bukkit.event.block.BlockFertilizeEvent event)
      On block fertilize. This is relevant to wildlife/farming gods
      Parameters:
      event - the event

    • onBlockIgnite

      public void onBlockIgnite​(org.bukkit.event.block.BlockIgniteEvent event)
      On block ignite. Always caused by players
      Parameters:
      event - the event

    • onBlockPhysics

      public void onBlockPhysics​(org.bukkit.event.block.BlockPhysicsEvent event)
      On block physics. Unlikely to happen, could be related to sand/gravel gods
      Parameters:
      event - the event

    • onBlockPiston

      public void onBlockPiston​(org.bukkit.event.block.BlockPistonEvent event)
      On block piston. Ultimately caused by a player, but we can't know who Thus, a clever way to deface an alter without repercussions. This is also heavily related to gods of machinery and invention.
      Parameters:
      event - the event

    • onBlockRedstone

      public void onBlockRedstone​(org.bukkit.event.block.BlockRedstoneEvent event)
      On block redstone. Heavily related to gods of machinery and invention.
      Parameters:
      event - the event

    • onSignChange

      public void onSignChange​(org.bukkit.event.block.SignChangeEvent event)
      On sign change. This can be used to clearly designate the name of the god.
      Parameters:
      event - the event

    • onNotePlayed
